title: Development of a viral exacerbation model of allergic asthma
abstractText: Patients with asthma tend to suffer increased asthma symptoms when they catch flu or other viral infections. However, we don?t know why this occurs or how to treat the symptoms effectively, and patients often need to increase their asthma medication or, in severe cases, be treated in hospital. We aim to develop a novel model of influenza infection in mice that are allergic to house dust mite (HDM). Our preliminary data has shown that influenza infection of HDM allergic mice increases inflammation in the lungs, and we now aim to investigate the mechanisms behind this increased inflammation and assess the impact on other asthma symptoms such as wheezing. By using this mouse model we will be able to investigate the relationships between viral infection and house dust mite exposure in order to investigate the molecules responsible for increased asthma symptoms. In addition we will be able to assess the affect of being allergic on recovery from influenza infection. Moreover we will be able to test potential novel drugs that will dampen immune responses and hopefully alleviate symptoms
